english.segment1: When everything is wrong. The day has passed and nothing's done. And the whole world seems against me. When I'm rolling in my bed, there's a storm in my head. I'm afraid of sinking in despair.
english.segment3: Teach me, Lord to have faith. In what you're bringing me will. Change my life and bring you glory &
english.segment4: There on the storm I am learning to let go. Of the will that I so long to control. There may I be in your arms eternally. I thank you, Lord, you are the calmer of the storm.
english.segment5: You rebuke the wind and the waves. Once again I find I'm amazed & the power of your will. Cuz I'm a child of little faith. I feel the wind and forget your grace. And you say, "Peace, be still."
english.segment6: There on the storm I am learning to let go. The white wave's high, it's crashing o'er the deck. And I don't know where I go. Where are you Lord, is my ship going down?. The mast is gone so throw the anchor. Should I jump and try to swim to land?
english.segment7: There on the storm, teach me God to understand. Of the Will that I just cannot control. There may I see all you love protecting me. I thank you Lord, you are the calmer of the storm.
